org.apache.mesos.scheduler.plan

Interface Block

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Element, Observable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultBlock, DefaultRecoveryBlock, ReconciliationBlock, TestBlock

    public interface Block
extends Element
    Defines the interface for a Block of a Phase. The block is the base unit of a set of tasks to perform, such as launching a Task, updating a Task, or reconciling Mesos state with Framework state. A Block may be in one of four states: PENDING, IN_PROGRESS, COMPLETE, or ERROR. A is an , and will notify its observers when its state changes.

    See docs for more background.

      Thrown on invalid Block construction attempt.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        java.util.Optional<OfferRequirement> start()
        Starts the Block, whose Status should be Status.PENDING. Returns an OfferRequirement, or an empty Optional if obtaining/updating resource requirements are not applicable to the Block. This will continue to be called for as long as Element.isPending() returns true.
        See Also:
        #updateOfferStatus(Collection)} which returns the outcome of the {@link OfferRequirement}

      • updateOfferStatus

        void updateOfferStatus(java.util.Collection<Offer.Operation> operations)
        Notifies the Block whether the OfferRequirement previously returned by start() has been successfully accepted/fulfilled. The operations param is empty when no offers matching the requirement previously returned by #clone() could be found. This is only called if {@link #start()} returned a non-{@code null} {@link OfferRequirement}.
